Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Processional \Pro*ces"sion*al\, n. [F. processionnal, LL. processionale.] [1913 Webster] 1. (R. C. Ch.) A service book relating to ecclesiastical processions. --J. Gregory. [1913 Webster]
2. A hymn, or other selection, sung during a church procession; as, the processional was the 202d hymn. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Processional \Pro*ces"sion*al\, a. Of or pertaining to a procession; consisting in a procession. [1913 Webster]
The processional services became more frequent. --Milman. [1913 Webster]

processional adj 1: intended for use in a procession; "processional music"; "processional cross" 2: of or relating to or characteristic of a procession; "in good processional order" n : religious music used in a procession [syn: {prosodion}]
